title: The Way We Live - A Candle For Judith (1971) (John Peel) (mp3)
description:
The Way We Live - "A Candle For Judith" (1971) (256kbps)

Track listing:
01.King Dick II (3:16) 
02.Squares (4:40) 
03.Siderial (3:47) 
04.Angle (1:22) 
05.Storm (5:26) 
06.Willow (6:27) 
07.Madrigal (2:01) 
08.The Way Ahead (8:45) 

The Way We Live:
- Steve Clayton - percussions, lyrics, backing vocals
- Jim Milne - all other instruments, music and vocals


Great debut album from English duo Jim Milne (guitarist/vocalist/songwriter) and Steve Clayton (drummer).

Performing under the name "The Way We Live" since 1966, they caught the attention of John Peel in 1970, who arranged for them to record their debut album.  This album, "A Candle For Judith" (named after Clayton's then girlfriend, later wife), was recorded in just two days, and was released in January 1971.  Today it is one of the great rarities of John Peel's Dandelion label.  (The duo only recorded one other album, the following year, under the name Tractor, a change suggested by Peel.  This album is also available here at TPB.)
